availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, engineer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Louisa Kirkpatrick. Father of Andrew Kirkpatrick, Lloyd Kirkpatrick, and Margaret Kirkpatrick. Engineer in Franklin County in 1860. Served in the 9th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from August 22, 1862, to August 21, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 240.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 107A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0097.
"David Kirkpatrick (1823-1886)," Find A Grave, Memorial 134462513, accessed December 8, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/134462513.
